rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Iris brandzae
rdf:Description.ns3:abstract: Iris brandzae is a species in the genus Iris, it is also in the subgenus Limniris and in series Spuriae. It is a rhizomatous perennial plant, originally from Romania with violet and white flowers. It was once thought to be a subspecies of Iris sintenisii, but now classified as a separate species. It is also called Iris Brandzy or Prodan Iris in Russia. It is cultivated as an ornamental plant in temperate regions.
rdf:Description.ns1:habitat:
Iris brandzea is native to Central Europe.
Iris brandzea native
rdf:Description.ns1:taxonomy:
The Latin specific epithet brandzae refers to botanist Dimitrie Brândză (1846–1895). specific epithet brandzae Dimitrie Brândză It is sometimes called Prodan Iris ,
or Iris Brandzy in Russia.
Prodan Iris
Iris Brandzy
It was originally published and described as Iris brandzae by Iuliu Prodan in Buletinul Gradinii Botanice si al Muzeului Botanic dela Universitatea din Cluj (Bul. Grad. Bot. Univ. Cluj) Vol.15 page103 in 1935.
Iris brandzae Iuliu Prodan Buletinul Gradinii Botanice si al Muzeului Botanic dela Universitatea din Cluj
It was also published by Czerep, in 1973 Svod Dopolm. Izmen Flora SSSR page301 and then by Geiderman in 1975, Opred. Vyssh. Rast. Mold SSR Ed2 page109.
Flora SSSR
It was later published as Iris sintenisii Janka subsp. brandzae (Prod.) D.A. Webb & Chater by D.A. Webb & Chater in the 'Botanical Journal of the Linnean Society' (Bot. J. Linn. Soc. 76.) in 1978,.
It was thought to have a more limited geographical distribution than Iris sintenisii , around Romania.
It stayed like this for many years until the authors of the Romanian flora books ('Flora Ilustrata a Romanie' by Ciocarlan 2009 and 'Plante Vasculare din Romania. Determinator ilustrat de teren (Vascular Plants of Romania. An illustrated field guide)' by Sarbu, Stefan et Oprea 2013
) re-classified the taxon as an independent and separate species.
Iris sintenisii Janka subsp. brandzae
Iris sintenisii
Although some references still call it Iris sintenisii Janka subsp. brandzae .
Iris sintenisii brandzae
It has not yet been verified by United States Department of Agriculture Agricultural Research Service as of February 2015. United States Department of Agriculture Agricultural Research Service Iris sintenisii subsp. brandzae , as of February 2015 was a tentatively accepted name by the RHS .
Iris sintenisii brandzae RHS
